thread.title: Brad Davis to sign one-day contract, retire with Dynamo

author: Corey Roepken
title: Brad Davis to sign one-day contract, retire with Dynamo

Alashe was sent off in the 60th minute after he grabbed and impeded Giles Barnes, earning his second yellow card of the match. less Dynamo midfielder Brad Davis, left, gets the worst of a collision with Earthquakes midfielder Fatai Alashe during the second half Saturday night at BBVA Compass Stadium. Alashe was given a yellow card in the ... more Photo: James Nielsen, Staff Brad Davis to sign one-day contract, retire with Dynamo 1 / 16 Back to Gallery 
Brad Davis was wearing a different uniform when he played his final game, but he always will be known for his greatest success in Houston. 
The Dynamo are honoring that next week. 
Davis will sign a one-day contract so he can retire as a Dynamo player at a press conference on Thursday. 
An original Dynamo player, Davis played in MLS from 2002-2016. The St. Charles, Mo., native spent 10 seasons with the Dynamo before being traded to Sporting Kansas City last year so he could play closer to his family. He retired after the Dynamo rival was eliminated in the playoffs. 
Known most for his magical left foot, Davis recorded double-digit assists in seven of his 10 seasons with Houston. His 120 assists in all competitions are most in Dynamo history by 90. He ranks third all-time in MLS history with 122 regular season assists. 
A six-time all-star and two-time MLS Cup champion, Davis also is the Dynamo's career leader in all competitions in games played (328), games started (302), minutes played (25,985). He is third in goals (45). 
Davis had 17 caps with the U.S. Men's National Team and was on the 2014 FIFA World Cup team. He started one group stage game against Germany. 
In addition to the one-day contract, the Dynamo will hold a charitable initiative in Davis' honor around a home game this season. Details are still to be determined.
